p: AG129 mice, which lack functioning type-I and -II IFN receptors, were also infected with high titer (10 5 pfu) or low titer (10 2 pfu) of the M-30 and S-27 viruses and their clinical courses were observed ( Figure 2). High titer infections with both viruses induced 100% fatality at 3 days pi ( Figure 2A). The M-30-infected mice showed lower weight reductions than the S-27-infected mice ( Figure 2B), and the weights of fatal mice were significantly different ( p < 0.0001) between the S-27 and M-30 infections ( Figure 2C).
